page.title: 09Wilmington Village
page.content:
Wilmington Village is a mixture of old and new houses. As one walks south through the village the first notable house on the right is Rose Cottage. This is a 15th Century timber framed house with a tiled roof and latticed windows. Beyond Ades Field is Pond Cottage with a half thatched roof. The oldest house in the village is Hunters Dene built in an L shape. The Chantry is another thatched building. If you look above the door there is a carved head,supposedly a caricature of an earlier vicar.
There are many clues about the history of the village in the house names such as the Old Bakehouse,Old Inn House and Pond Cottage.
